00001 /***********************************************
00002 File : DynamicTypeCollection.h
00003 *************************************************/
00004 
00005 #pragma once
00006 
00007 #include <list>
00008 #include <string>
00009 #include "Singleton.h"
00010 
00011 namespace PDI
00012 {
00013 
00014 class DynamicTypeElement;
00015 /***********************************************
00016  The DynamicTypeCollection class is a singleton that holds a list 
00017   of DynamicTypeElements. This is a singleton because we will only
00018    have one collection of these, and also because we want to make
00019    it easier to access the data.  We don't want to have to pass
00020    a pointer out to the calling program (the Main.cpp file in the
00021    cajun test folder, or the dissector.cpp file in babelshark include
00022    folder).
00023 *************************************************/
00024 class DynamicTypeCollection : public Singleton<DynamicTypeCollection>
00025 {
00026 public:
00027    /*** The DynamicTypeCollection function is just a simple constructor.
00028      ***/
00029    DynamicTypeCollection();
00030 
00031    /*** The ~DynamicTypeCollection function is just a simple destructor.
00032      * It will call the ClearCollection function.
00033      ***/
00034    ~DynamicTypeCollection();
00035 
00036    typedef std::list<DynamicTypeElement> DynamicTypeCollectionTypeDef;
00037    typedef DynamicTypeCollectionTypeDef::iterator iterator;
00038    typedef DynamicTypeCollectionTypeDef::const_iterator const_iterator;
00039    iterator Begin();
00040    iterator End();
00041    const_iterator Begin() const;
00042    const_iterator End() const;
00043 
00044    /*** The Insert function is used to insert a DynamicTypeElement in
00045      * the DynamicTypeCollection.  There will be one call to the insert
00046      * function for each dynamictype found in the PDI File.
00047      ***/
00048    iterator Insert(const DynamicTypeElement& dynamicTypeElementToAdd);
00049 
00050    /*** The FillDataDictionary function iterates over each DynamicTypeElement
00051      * in the collection.  Each DynamicTypeElement contains a name and a
00052      * list of DynamicTypeEntry objects.  For each DynamicTypeEntry, a function
00053      * call will be made to add it to the DataDictionary.  The function
00054      * call will be DataDictionary::AddDynamic(std::string alias, 
00055      *    std::string parameter, std::string typeName)
00056      * where alias is the name field from DynamicTypeElement,
00057      * parameter is the first field inside DynamicTypeEntry, and
00058      * typeName is the seconed field inside DynamicTypeEntry.
00059      ***/
00060    void FillDataDictionary();
00061 
00062 protected:
00063 
00064 private:
00065    DynamicTypeCollectionTypeDef m_DynamicTypeCollection;
00066 };
00067 
00068 } // End namespace
